IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: UPPER IOWA UNIVERSITY PROVIDES QUALITY EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES ACCESSIBLE THROUGH VARIED DELIVERY METHODS TO INSPIRE SUCCESS AND EMPOWER LIVES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: UPPER IOWA UNIVERSITY PROVIDES QUALITY EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES ACCESSIBLE THROUGH VARIED DELIVERY METHODS TO INSPIRE SUCCESS AND EMPOWER LIVES.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION, INSTRUCTION, AND SUPPORT - UPPER IOWA UNIVERSITY SERVED 3,031 STUDENTS WORLDWIDE. THE FAYETTE CAMPUS SERVED 572 TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS, DRAWING THE MAJORITY OF THESE STUDENTS FROM IOWA, MINNESOTA, WISCONSIN AND ILLINOIS. THE UNIVERSITY IS DIVERSE IN ITS ETHNICITY, RACE, GENDER, ECONOMICS, AND GEOGRAPHY. UNDERGRADUATE DEGREES ARE OFFERED THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF EDUCATION, THE SCHOOL OF BUSINESS, AND THE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCES. UPPER IOWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS SEVERAL MASTER'S DEGREES, BOTH ONLINE AND FACE-TO-FACE. MASTER'S DEGREES ARE AVAILABLE IN EDUCATION, BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION, HEALTHCARE ADMINISTRATION, COUNSELING, SPORT ADMINISTRATION, AND PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION. POST-GRADUATE CERTIFICATES ALSO ARE AVAILABLE IN ACCOUNTING, CORPORATE FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, LITERACY COACH, TEACHER LEADERSHIP AND ORGANIZATIONAL DEVELOPMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES - RESIDENCE HALLS, FOOD SERVICES, LOGO STORE, ETC. FOR THE ABOVE STUDENTS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: KATHY FRANKEN VP OF FINANCE AND ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS HELD BY OTHERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S ARTWORK CONSISTS OF VARIOUS SCULPTURES LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE CAMPUS TO BEAUTIFY THE CAMPUS AND HIGHLIGHT THE UNIVERSITY'S DIVERSITY.
THE UNIVERSITY IS A CUSTODIAN OF BANK ACCOUNTS FOR VARIOUS STUDENT GROUPS.

THE UNIVERSITY SPENDS THE DISTRIBUTIONS FROM OUR UNRESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS FOR OPERATIONS AND FOR THE RESTRICTED PURPOSE FOR ALL RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS. THE RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE PRIMARILY RESTRICTED FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, BUT ALSO INCLUDE SMALL FUNDS FOR EQUIPMENT, PROFESSORSHIPS, LIBRARY BOOKS, AND ATHLETICS. THE DISTRIBUTION IS DETERMINED BY THE SPEND POLICY AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD.

THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE HAS DETERMINED THAT THE UNIVERSITY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ACCORDINGLY, THE UNIVERSITY IS NOT SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAXES EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT IT DERIVES INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT SUBSTANTIALLY RELATED TO ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES (UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES). THE UNIVERSITY IS ALSO EXEMPT FROM STATE INCOME TAXES. THE FOREIGN SUBSIDIARIES ARE TAXABLE ENTITIES IN THE COUNTRIES THEY ARE LOCATED. ACCRUED TAX PAYABLE AND INCOME TAX EXPENSE ARE RELATED TO THE FOREIGN SUBSIDIARIES. THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS THE ACCOUNTING STANDARDS FOR CONTINGENCIES IN EVALUATING UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THIS GUIDANCE PRESCRIBES RECOGNITION THRESHOLD PRINCIPLES FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN THAT ARE NOT CERTAIN TO BE REALIZED. NO LIABILITY HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE UNIVERSITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 AND 2021. THE UNIVERSITY'S TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE AUTHORITIES.
CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS HELD BY OTHERS DIRECT RENTAL EXPENSES 52,957. DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 31,490.
SCHOLARSHIPS, TUITIONS AND GRANTS 16,050,997. TRANSFER OF CASH AND PREPAID TUITION 681,084. CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS HELD BY OTHERS 1,118,295.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 31,490. DIRECT RENTAL EXPENSES 52,957. ELIMINATED DISREGARDED ENTITY EXPENSES 1,914,645.
SCHOLARSHIPS, TUITIONS AND GRANTS 16,050,997.

NONDISCRIMINATION POLICIES ARE AVAILABLE ONLINE AT UIU.EDU. NONDISCRIMINATION POLICIES ARE ALSO PUBLISHED IN THE STUDENT HANDBOOK. DURING ENROLLMENT EACH YEAR, STUDENTS SIGN AN AGREEMENT INDICATING THEIR RESPONSIBILITY FOR READING AND UNDERSTANDING THE CONTENTS OF THE HANDBOOK.
FINANCIAL AID WAS RECEIVED FROM THE GOVERNMENT IN THE FORM OF PELL GRANTS, SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANTS (SEOG), COLLEGE WORK-STUDY (CWS) PROGRAMS, AND OTHER SMALL GOVERNMENT GRANTS.
ACCRUAL METHOD
THE UNIVERSITY HOLDS DIRECT INTERESTS IN FOREIGN CORPORATIONS. HOWEVER, THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MEET THE FILING REQUIREMENTS OF FORM 926 AS A RESULT.

THE UNIVERSITY INVESTS IN PARTNERSHIPS THAT HOLD DIRECT OR INDIRECT INTERESTS IN PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANIES. THE INVESTMENT PARTNERSHIPS HAVE PROPERLY FILED FORM 8621, OR THE UNDERLYING INVESTMENTS DID NOT GENERATE ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. UNDER THESE FACTS, IT IS NOT NECESSARY FOR THE UNIVERSITY TO FILE AN ADDITIONAL 8621.
THE UNIVERSITY INVESTS IN PARTNERSHIPS THAT HOLD DIRECT OR INDIRECT INTERESTS IN FOREIGN PARTNERSHIPS. HOWEVER, THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT MEET THE FILING REQUIREMENTS OF FORM 8865 AS A RESULT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISER ASSISTS WITH THE COMPLETION OF GRANT APPLICATIONS.

STUDENT ENROLLMENT IS MONITORED ON A REGULAR BASIS. AFTER VERIFICATION OF ENROLLMENT EACH TERM, FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS' EDUCATIONAL COSTS PER FEDERAL REGULATIONS. STUDENT WITHDRAWALS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND GRANT FUNDS ARE ADJUSTED AND RETURNED AS NECESSARY. EXPENSES AND INCOME FOR OTHER GRANTS ARE TRACKED IN ACCOUNTS SET UP SPECIFICALLY FOR THE GRANT. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A PROJECT INVESTIGATOR THAT OVERSEES THE SPENDING OF THE FUNDS AND ENSURES THEY ARE USED AS INTENDED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART III, EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS THE HIGHER EDUCATION RELIEF FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE CARES ACT FOR DIRECT DISTRIBUTION TO STUDENTS.

TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS: WHEREAS THERE IS AN EXPECTATION THAT IN THE COURSE OF HIS DUTIES, THE PRESIDENT AND/OR HIS SPOUSE ARE EXPECTED TO ATTEND CERTAIN PROFESSIONAL FUNCTIONS, ENTERTAIN GUESTS OF THE UNIVERSITY, AND BUILD AND MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH ALUMNI, FRIENDS OF THE UNIVERSITY, MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY, AND OTHERS. THE UNIVERSITY SHALL PAY FOR ALL REASONABLE ENTERTAINMENT, TRAVEL, AND SIMILAR COSTS INCURRED BY THE PRESIDENT AND/OR HIS SPOUSE WHILE ACTING ON THE UNIVERSITY'S BEHALF. NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION. HOUSING ALLOWANCE OR RESIDENCE FOR PERSONAL USE: THE UNIVERSITY PAYS FOR THE PRESIDENT'S RESIDENCE AND THE RELATED REPAIRS. NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION. HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES OR INITIATION FEES: THE PRESIDENT'S CONTRACT PROVIDES FOR THE UNIVERSITY TO PAY HIS FAMILY'S MEMBERSHIP AT BIG ROCK COUNTRY CLUB. INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION.
THE AMOUNT IN PART I, COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF THE OFFICERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE HAS THE POWER TO ACT FOR THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES BETWEEN ITS SESSIONS, ON ISSUES CONSISTENT WITH PRIOR BOARD APPROVAL. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY NOT TAKE ANY ACTION INCONSISTENT WITH A PRIOR ACT OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AWARD DEGREES, ALTER BYLAWS, OR LOCATE PERMANENT BUILDINGS ON TAX-EXEMPT PROPERTY HELD FOR UNIVERSITY PURPOSES, REMOVE OR APPOINT THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY, OR TAKE ANY ACTION THAT HAS BEEN RESERVED FOR THE BOARD, UNLESS SPECIFICALLY EMPOWERED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO DO SO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE OUTSIDE PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY MANAGEMENT. THE CFO AND THE CONTROLLER REVIEW THE FINAL DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 AND SUPPORTING SCHEDULES. THE BOARD REVIEWS THE FORM 990 BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUSTEES OR OFFICERS OF UPPER IOWA UNIVERSITY WILL DISCLOSE TO THE BOARD ANY EXISTING OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. WITH RESPECT TO SPECIFIC TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING SUCH AN INTEREST, THE DISCLOSURE WILL BE MADE AT THE EARLIEST POSSIBLE TIME AND ANNUALLY AFTER THAT. TRUSTEES OR OFFICERS WILL NOT VOTE ON, NOR PARTICIPATE IN DISCUSSING, ANY MATTER IN WHICH THEY HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, EXCEPT TO PROVIDE INFORMATION. TRUSTEES OR OFFICERS WHO ARE UNCERTAIN ABOUT A POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST MAY REQUEST THAT THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DETERMINE WHETHER A CONFLICT EXISTS. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE, SECRETARY, AND TREASURER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES GATHERS AND REVIEWS THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORMS AND DEALS WITH THE INFORMATION APPROPRIATELY AS NECESSARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENTIAL EVALUATION COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE EVALUATION SHALL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING: ASSESSMENT OF THE COMPLETION OF THE GOALS SET FOR THE CURRENT YEAR, AND SETTING NEW GOALS FOR THE FOLLOWING YEAR (GOALS SHOULD INCLUDE SPECIFIC ITEMS SUCH AS ENROLLMENT PROJECTIONS ON AND OFF CAMPUS, AMOUNT OF INCOME PROJECTED, AND RAISES). THE PRESIDENTIAL EVALUATION COMMITTEE MET TO REVIEW GOALS, DELIVERABLES FOR THE OVERALL UNIVERSITY AS PRESIDENT, AND MARKET DATA FOR THE POSITION. THE EVALUATION COMMITTEE MET WITH THE PRESIDENT TO DETERMINE GOALS, AND DISCUSSED THE PROCESS AND RECOMMENDATION WITH THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES VOTED TO RENEW THE PRESIDENT'S CONTRACT FOR COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS. THE EVALUATION WAS LAST CARRIED OUT IN JUNE OF 2021 AND COVERS A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS. THE NEXT EVALUATION WILL BE COMPLETED DURING SUMMER OF 2024. THE PRESIDENT NEGOTIATES CONTRACTS AND SETS COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE HAS AN "ABOUT UIU" LINK THAT PROVIDES THE PUBLIC WITH INFORMATION REGARDING OUR MISSION, VISION, STRATEGIC PLAN, AND OTHER NEWS AND INFORMATIONAL ITEMS. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT POST THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, OR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON THE PUBLIC WEBSITE.
CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS HELD BY OTHERS -1,118,295. CUMULATIVE EFFECT OF ADOPTION OF NEW STANDARD 108,424. TRANSFER OF CASH AND PREPAID TUITION TO US ENTITY -681,084.
